content: DH and I made this for dinner last night and our only complaint was that we ate too much becuase it was so good! Only change I made was used garlic powder instead of roasted garlic in the tapenade as we were short on time. Thank you for posting.
Great dish to make and serve right off the grill. Flavor was so wonderful.

Absolutely loved this! We fought over who was getting the left overs for lunch. It was equally as delicious as left overs. I added feta cheese. I may cut the lemon juice down in the veggies the next time.
This has so much flavor and easy to make! This is will be a new regular at our house!! I served it with some angel hair with a little garlic and olive oil....home run:)

This was ABSOLUTELY delicious!!! My family loved it and had seconds! I doubled it so my husband and I finished it last night. We sprinkled a little bit of feta on top as well. Thank you for sharing your recipe!
This was amazing!!! Will make many times over!
This was AMAZING!! Hubby liked it a lot too! He asked me, when I make it again, to make more of the avocado tapenade! This is a keeper! Thanks!

Loved this grilled chicken dish. I can always tell when a recipe is a winner as my hubby went back for seconds and made a happy plate!! The avocado tapenade was a great addition -- I just wish I had taken the time to roast some garlic; however, the minced fresh garlic was fine. Thanks for the post.
VERY Good and the husband loved it!
Didn't change a thing! This recipe made fantastic lunches for the week. It tasted so fresh and yummy! Thanks for posting!
This was amazing!!! Will make many times over!
This was AMAZING!! Hubby liked it a lot too! He asked me, when I make it again, to make more of the avocado tapenade! This is a keeper! Thanks!

Loved this grilled chicken dish. I can always tell when a recipe is a winner as my hubby went back for seconds and made a happy plate!! The avocado tapenade was a great addition -- I just wish I had taken the time to roast some garlic; however, the minced fresh garlic was fine. Thanks for the post.
VERY Good and the husband loved it!
Didn't change a thing! This recipe made fantastic lunches for the week. It tasted so fresh and yummy! Thanks for posting!
This was amazing!!! Will make many times over!
This was AMAZING!! Hubby liked it a lot too! He asked me, when I make it again, to make more of the avocado tapenade! This is a keeper! Thanks!

Loved this grilled chicken dish. I can always tell when a recipe is a winner as my hubby went back for seconds and made a happy plate!! The avocado tapenade was a great addition -- I just wish I had taken the time to roast some garlic; however, the minced fresh garlic was fine. Thanks for the post.
VERY Good and the husband loved it!
Didn't change a thing! This recipe made fantastic lunches for the week. It tasted so fresh and yummy! Thanks for posting!

This is good Falafel! I could not find dried fava beans, so I used well drained canned. The blend of spices were so good. I served with Recipe #59336 and some red onions sliced very thinly inside pita bread. I will make again. Made and Reviewed for ANZ Recipe Swap #25 - Thanks! :)
See More
I love falafel so much and this recipe makes them so easy to do at home. The key is to remember to soak the beans the night before! Followed the recipe exactly and it was great.

These are as good as any falafel I've eaten from American west to east coasts (i.e., San Francisco to NYC). I, too, couldn't find "broad beans", aka "fava beans", so I used all garbanzo beans, which is fairly traditional from my understanding. Great flavors! I served them in recipe #187699. Thanks, Che floWer! Made for PRMR.
See More

No stars because I really didn't know what to expect from this recipe. I've never had Falafel before and just thought this would be a nice change of pace. It didn't go over as well as I'd hoped. We found them bland, which surprised me given the delectable spices that went into them, and dry. Now a friend of mine who has had Falafel in Israel liked them though she agreed they were a bit dry and suggested adding a small amount of extra virgin olive oil to the mix. I may try this again adding oil and doubling the spices, if I do I'll update my review.
See More

First time making (though long time eating!) falafel and this was surprisingly easy and really really good (I used all dried garbanzos though). They were crispy on the outside and super tender in the middle. They had really good flavor too even though I had no coriander nor cilantro. A couple things I'd do different next time, and recommend to others: 1) Careful not to chop/puree the chickpea mixture too much. I over-did it and they were a bit too runny. Stop when the mixture is still a bit course. 2) When deep-frying I found they did best at 350 degrees for 5 minutes (though I found another recipe telling me 375, I thought they came out too dark at that temp). 3) Sprinkle with course salt immediately after removing from the frier, the salt will stick better when they are still hot.
See More
Loved these little fish foil packets so much. They were so easy and the oven does all the work for you which is always a nice bonus. These would be great thrown on the grill as well.

Sooooo good! I rarely write reviews but this one is worth it. Very quick and easy. I did find that I needed to cook it about 28 min instead of the suggested 15-20. I probably ended up doubling the amount of veggies to just because I love zucchini so much. Very happy I have another new fish recipe in my cookbook! Oh also, I wasn't able to find an actual Greek seasoning so I got a seasoning that had similar ingredients.
See More
Looks (and sounds) awesome!!! Love tilapia!!!
This looks really delicious !
Awesome recipe ~ mouthwatering!!!!
So good and easy. Served with Mediterranean couscous salad.

This is an absolutely delicious concept for fish, as far as I'm concerned. My bride's Thai girlfriend happened thru as I brought this out of a toaster oven. She tried it, and immediately asked me, "Where is the lemon?" I forgot the LEMON! Still, amazing dish for even a bungler like me!
Yum, I'm making this one!
Sans the olives this sounds delish. I love tilapia and Greek anything.
This looks really good and doesn't take forever to prepare.
This looks so simple and delicious! Wow!!
Yum, sounds great!!
Great combination of flavors for the tilapia! Great job!!!!!
Wonderful flavors you put together! This is the way I cook most my fish....Love It!!!
love the fish and cheese idea...going to make this!
Looks so good! Yum!
Wow does this ever look amazing! Can't wait to try it!
Now this is the way to cook Tilapia! Looks and sounds so good! My husband will love this!
Just bought talapia so I can try this Sherri!
Great recipe for Tilapia!
I have tilapia in the freezer right now...this will be for supper tomorrow night ! I love the flavors !
I'm diggin' this!
Yum
Sounds so good!!
Beautiful Sherri!
*Love* the combination of tilapia, tomatoes, prosciutto and herbs. So good!
Yummmmm
Terrific!
This was and is one of the best Fish recipes you can make.... So delicious your Family will love it!!!!
Looks and Sounds So Delicious!! Love All These Flavors:-)
I love lentils so much, and wanted to try something new. This recipe is a keeper. I've never had anything like this before and will definitely be making it again!

i have made this salad several times now and love it! i use the french puy lentils but don't cook them as long as the recipe states. i use dried mint, and also reduce the garlic since in this recipe it is not cooked. i founf that this makes great leftovers, the flavors blend and intensify. i plan to make this a lot over the summer.
See More

This was really good. I didn't know what to expect since it is my first experience with lentil salad, but it certainly won't be the last. The only change I made to the recipe was to lower the amount of oil. I do agree with one review that it is best served in smaller quantities since it is quite bold. I will be making this again.
See More

I liked this. It was easy to prepare as I had all of the ingredients on hand. I used mint AND fresh basil. I cut out 1 tablespoon each of the oil and lemon juice and it was just right. I brought the lentils to a boil and then turned them down to a very low simmer for 25 minutes. They were almost a little too soft but most of them held their shape really well. I poured ice water over them to stop the cooking process. Good recipe and good for you, too.
See More

I actually tried this recipe because I adore all kinds of varieties and flavors of Salsa that adds to my main dishes. It could be PASTA, a Baked Potato, not just meat, and this particular salsa is DELICIOUS!! Very filling. I highly recommend this salsa recipe if you love Lentils like myself.
See More

This was a simple and plain grain salad recipe. While that might work for some, I won't make it again. There are too many out there! For my next meal/leftovers, I added garlic powder, extra lemon juice, salt and pepper to taste, and lemon zest to add a little extra flavor. Those changes helped make it better but still not excellent.
Simply delicious and so easy! I'd definitely recommend using fresh mint if you can get it; fortunately we have some spearmint growing in our garden. Perfect dish for a steamy summer day.
Delicious! I used a package of pre-cooked lentils that I bought at Trader Joe's, so the prep was a snap. I made exactly as written and it was a big hit!
Delicious with our without the cheese.
This is amazing. I nixed the mint and added english cucumber. My only regret is that I didn't have enough feta cheese.....

I made this recipe to take to a softball club BBQ. It was an outstanding success and voted best salad at the BBQ. So would recommend it as an economical, easy to make and delicious dish with a colourful presentation.

oh, I loved this salad. I prepared the dressing separately and only added what I needed which was probably about half. It needs lots of freshly ground black pepper. I used green lentils and it was so nice even though I only had about 4oz of feta. I made mine at the start of the week and it kept well in the fridge for a couple of days. One lot of left-overs I added some cherry tomatoes and on another portion I added some diced fresh beetroot (OMG that made it even better). Dont omit the mint as it makes this salad. It was lovely to eat something that tasted so sinful yet it really good for you!!!!!!! Thanks Mindy xxx

The girlfriend was so-so on this, but I enjoyed it. I think it would make a healthy and economical addition to a BBQ or picnic. The meat-eaters in out family LOVE grilled lamb and I bet that this would be a hit as a side dish.

Great recipe! We really enjoyed this, but it was strong enough (in a good and bold kind of way) that I think next time I'd plan on getting more servings out of this as smaller side dishes. Still, so delicious, and the mint was really a great touch. Thank you!
The feta really made this special adding just the right amount of saltiness and punch. I agree that a bit of tomato would also have been a good addition.

This is delicious! I have fresh mint in my garden and used it in this recipe. You're right, it gives it a wonderful flavor. I also used fresh lemons for the juice and can lentils for convenience/speed. The thing I love most about this salad is that it's perfect for brown bag lunches, and it's super healthy. I'm making more tonight. Thank you for posting!

Taking note of Stardustannie's review, I used tinned lentils, which made it so quick to make for lunch today. A nice blend of salty, sour sweet from the capsicum and an interesting mix of textures. I would have enjoyed maybe half the capsicum and a tomato in it.

I agree. This is a very refreshing salad. Instructions were easy to follow and so easy to put together. I was a real hit with the family. It was such a light meal to have; get filling. I served this with spinach salad and Greek Potatoes - recipe #87782. Thank you for sharing your recipe with us.

A very refreshing salad that's easy to throw together....would be made quicker with the use of canned lentils. I had it for lunch with some nice home made bread...YUMMO! Can’t wait till the BBQ season now, it'll be a great addition to the salad table.

Cooking lentils on low heat will help them keep their structure. It takes a little longer, but it will keep them from turning into dal. Also, french lentils are smaller and fatter than other lentils (ie: most lentils you find in the supermarket). French lentils are used when you want to keep them whole for salads and such. I have done the low heat on regular lentils, and it works for me. Also, salting your water before you bring the lentils to a boil can help them keep their shape.
Okay, this is awesome! The flavors are fantastic. BUT, HELP - my lentils went all mushy. Did I overcook, or are they supposed to be mushy (like dahl)??

This is delicious; I've had the recipe for a while and made it several times (most recently for a 4th of July barbecue) and everyone who tries it is impressed. I really like the flavor of the mint. This time, I found there was too much dressing (I think this may be in part because I didn't use the full amount of cheese), so if your measurements are a bit loose, it might be a good idea to whisk those ingredients together and then add as needed. I've successfully used balsamic vinegar instead of lemon juice; it's a different flavor, but still very tasty.
This is a superb salad, one that I am sure to make often. The ingredients while simplistic prefectly blend with each other. Wouldn't change a thing. Thank you Mindy for sharing this wonderful recipe.

This salad is wonderful! I cheated though and used canned lentils because I was in a hurry and it was fine. The fresh mint, lemon and garlic is a wonderful combination and the feta cheese just tops it off. I will be making this again and again for sure. It would be great for a pot-luck too, because it's a little out-of-the-ordinary and there's not likely to be two lentil salads. Thanks Mindy!

I KNEW I would like this - all of the ingredients are my favorites! This was so delicious that I had to eat some of it before it even cooled. ( I did omit the mint to please the family) I know this will be in our dining room quite frequently. Thanks ever so much for sharing!
I'm starting to cook more with balsamic vinegar and this one hit the spot. I used white button, less oil and no salt. Delicious! Made for Zaar Cookbook Tag Game 2011.
These were wonderful! I used generic button mushrooms on sale at the supermarket and a healthy dash of Moroccan paprika as well. Made for ZWT 5.

These were good mushrooms, but in making several varieties at once, found them of be lacking in flavor comparatively. The addition of garlic or shallots, would definitely make an improvement. Thanks for sharing your recipe made for ZWT 5 for the Cooks With Dirty Faces
See More
This was quick and easy. I have another similar recipe but it has more spices...garlic, parsley, oregano and such. This is better if I need to put soemthing together quickly though.
These were delicious! I do think some chopped garlic would be a great addition, but great as is :)
These were good mushrooms. Like others, I used less oil and salt. I didn't think it was too much balsamic, the juice left in the pan was more mushroom water than vinegar-y tasting.

I just love dishes that you can make ahead.........and then serve cold or hot. I did this the day before and served it cold as part of a brunch. Easy, simple and fast. . . can't beat it. Thanks Debber

Love mushrooms; loved this very easy recipe! I omitted the red pepper flakes and instead added some minced garlic, some lemon zest and some thyme (zero tolerance of anything hot and spicy) but otherwise made as instructed. Two of us ate these with some garlic bread for a truly delicious meal. Thanks for sharing! Made for Ali Baba's Babes for ZWT 5.
We really enjoyed these, used a little less oil and added a little bit of garlic. Thank you for posting. Made for ZWT5

These were a huge hit with everyone over 10 in my house! My husband looked at my and said, "These mushrooms are fantastic!" - true praise indeed. These will be coming back to my table after the Tour. Thank you for posting. Made for ZWT5, for the Groovy GastroGnomes.

These were wonderful. My man and I ate the whole batch by ourselves. I did cut down on the oil and I added chopped garlic. Other than that I followed the recipe. So very good. I will make these often. Thanks.
Wonderful! I served this alongside a simple baked chicken dish and cheesey-orzo. Simple and just perfect.
Soooo good. I used portabella because that is what I had on hand. Absolutely love the Red Pepper Flakes. It really kicks the recipe up. I serve with grilled steak. Thank you so much for sharing.

Fabulous! I made as directed except I probably didn't put in as much red pepper. (I'm a wimp.) These were terrific! I served them with Recipe #134820, and let me tell you, they *made* that dish. But they are good on their own too! Reviewed for ZWT4.

Very nice mushrooms! After reading Boomette's review, I made sure to use less balsamic. Since I have an overflowing herb pot, I also followed Leggy Peggy and added some fresh parsley, oregano, and mint. Made for ZWT 4 by a Jefe de la Cocina.
I love mushrooms and balsamic vinegar! Yum! I did skip the red pepper flakes.
Great mushrooms! I love balsamic and red pepper flakes, so the flavours were perfect. Also sprinkled on some dried parsley, oregano and mint. Garnished with roasted red capsicum. Yummo!
I liked the heat of this dish. But I felt like there was too much balsamic vinegar. Maybe another time I would try with 2 tablespoon. I omitted the salt. Thanks Debber. Made for the Babes of ZWT4

Made for ZWT4...These were pretty good. The balsamic vinegar was a little to strong for us but it grew on me as I ate them. Only one of the kids liked them and hubby said they were ok but the vinegar was too strong.

Loved these delicious mushrooms! What can I say that hasn't already been said? Great flavor, extremely easy prep and fast cook time, and as you said, pairs well with steak. I served it with a South American style steak and thought it complimented it very nicely. Thanks for this delicious dish, Debber--we'll be making it again. Made for ZWT4.
Outstanding flavour! These mushrooms were so good. I made them exactly as written and they were perfect. Made for ZWT4
Nice flavor and a fun/easy side dish. Left out the red pepper flakes as DH doesn't like "hot". Will make this again and may try it with asparagus cuts. Made for my teammate for ZWT4.

I love mushrooms, and this is a great way to prepare them! They barely made it to our plates... I love the way you only taste the spicyness at the end because of the balsamico sweetness. Great for sort of like a tapas meal i think. Made for ZWT4 for team TTT
SPECTACULAR! Loving the balsamic addition!!!!
These are very tasty when hot and I can't wait to taste them cold. Seems to me it would be a great 'appy' for a get together. So easy to make also.
Really great! I made them with Christmas prime rib dinner and everyone loved them. I used a mixture of white and brown mushrooms. Thank-you!
These were sooo good and even my husband who insists he hates mushrooms liked these. Thanks!
Very good, simple recipe. I did mine as a side with hot pepper salmon and they went perfectly. Thanks!

These are very good, and I too can see where they would be great with a steak. I had them alone as a midnight treat after working the evening shift. I forgot to add the salt in, but will try it next time even though it was great without it. A easy recipe from a great and fun chef! Thanks Debber!!!

A nice, easy treat for mushroom lovers! I'm sure these are great on steak, because they are great just by themselves! I halved the amount of salt, but otherwise made no changes. I'm looking forward to making this again with an assortment of different mushrooms. Thanx for sharing!

Thanks for an absolutely wonderful dish. Actually, it was a money saver, too....had mushrooms that needed to be used "immediatley" that I had somehow forgotten. This is definitely a keeper, as mushrooms are a favorite of mine! I must say that as much as I love balsamic vinegar I had never thought of blending the two. Thanks for sharing.
The best salmon recipe on Zaar. I make it over and over again. Sometimes I double the marinade since that is the best part and add a bit of water at the end to have some gravy.

I baked instead of seared this, mainly because I had a whole side of salmon and was feeling lazy, but it was excellent. I made a fairly large amount of the paste (using the proportions in the recipe of course) which I spread on the flesh side and baked in a rimmed baking sheet at 450Âº for 10 minutes (it was about 1" thick at the thickest). As an aside, the paste did not burn when baking it.
See More

Awesome recipe!!! I was looking for a pan-seared recipe for salmon and this is wonderful! I did add about 1/2 tsp of tumeric to the marinade, but other than that, it was as listed. I seared it in my stainless steel pan with just a spray of canola oil. I had no problem with sticking. Served this with some jasmine rice and beets (at my dd's request). Pam
See More
https://worldfashiontips.com/

This was a great flavor combination with the fish. A bit spicy, but not enough to blow your head off, and very easy to mix up. I left the skin on, put the marinade on the flesh side, and let it sit for about 1/2 hour. Then I grilled it skin side down. A wonderful meal, made for ZWT9
See More

Other than electing to bake the fish I followed the recipe exactly. The salmon filets were over one inch thick so I spread the paste on both sides and placed in a sprayed foil lined pan. It turned out fantastic! All of the flavors were there, but blended into magic. Thank you for sharing a recipe I'll use again.
Easy to make and so tasty!! We will make this again...made for ZWT #9!
Easy and Delicious. Great for our first dinner in Morocco. Made for ZWT9 for Hot Stuff
I, too, could not taste the rub on this one and I pan seared it as stated. I followed the recipe to the letter. Still love the flavor of plain salmon...but wasn't tasting any of the seasoning.

Won't leave stars b/c I baked instead of pan seared. I did not enjoy this at all...It sat for about 1 1/2 hrs with the rub and I couldn't really even taste the rub at all. It didn't impart flavor to my fish at all. Not sure what I did wrong, but probably won't make this again.
This was great! I loved the flavors of the paprika and cumin and it seared very nicely. I served this with broccoli (recipe #220471) and brown rice and the meal was exceptional! Thanks for sharing!
Huge hit at our house. Took the suggestion of adding Tumeric and baked on 400 for 12-15 min. Yum Yum

OH So Niceeeee. I didnt fry the salmon though. :/ I made the paste, added a little extra olive oil, Coated the salmon, wrapped it in aluminum foil and shoved it in the oven for about 30-40 minutes. It in kept all the flavours and juices.. The colour of the salmon was gorgeous, and the taste.. Just Tantalizing. But before that, for the Paste, i Crushed the garlic (with salt) in a wooden bowl, added the cilantro, crushed some more, then everything else. plus a little extra lemon, small teaspoon salt and more oil. This is definately one recipe i will be using again and again. With it, i served, asparagus and snow peas, carrot and whole potatoes roasted in foil. Very healthy and delish. Much enjoyed, thank you!

This is excellent! I halved the recipe for two salmon fillets. The only thing I would do differently next time is make more of the marinate. The marinade tastes incredible, but much of that taste gets lost in the searing. I'd reserve a teaspoon or so of fresh marinade to top each fillet before serving.

I didn't have any lemon in the house and so I actually added a few drops of lemon extract. We don't like cilantro either. Even with those changed, this was great. The paste does tend to get black during cooking, but I don't think that's a problem at all, blackened is delicious too.
This is a very easy and tasty way to prepare salmon. Really loved the spice combo. Served with couscous and roasted asparagus. I am going to try this on the grill come summertime!
I have made this a few times now and each time it has turned out wonderful. The flavours go so well together. I have cooked it on the BBQ and under the grill, both ways were delicious
Wow, this was fabulous. Very easy to make, but the taste was wonderful. I took Pam-I-Am's suggestion of adding turmeric, which we loved. I served this with bbq vegies. Thanks Sharon for this keeper.
Fast, easy and fun to eat! Has a great kick! Have already made it more than once.

Yum! We both liked this a lot. Made it for ZWT III and practically licked the plate clean. Thanks for a fabulous dinner! P.S. Sharon...now that I've ACTUALLY made this I could not improve upon my original comments if i wanted to!
Simple, elegant and with a bit of heat to complement the salmon. The rub was really easy to make, but as other reviewers have said, you need to watch it carefully so it doesn't burn.
I have decided this will be my signature dish for company... Fabulous! Hint for rookies: Be careful when searing... this paste can burn... so don't let yourself be distracted!

As others have mentioned this recipe has excellent flavor. My only suggestion is to watch the cooking carefully. I think of searing as a hot, moisture-sealing method and this paste burns too easily to cook on a hot grill. Medium at most, please, start to finish.

Excellent. I love this. And it was really easy. I refrigerated it only one-hour. Next time I'll give it the full two-hours. The paste turned into a flavorful crust and the salmon was so tender and moist. I served it with steamed rice, and cucumbers with yogurt and green onions. Great recipe.

This was delicious, and really easy. I also added a bit of mint to the marinade as I had some floating about. I served this with couscous. My only criticism is that the portion size given was definitely not enough for 2.

A definate keeper that will go into cookbook for 2. I prepared the paste and salmon about 2 hours before cooking. I cooked the salmon in my grill pan and it left very nice "grill" marks. This is a well flavored dish that I will make again. Thanks so much for sharing this recipe.

This was almost perfect! I didn't have a mandolin, so I hand sliced, and loved how delicious the vegetable blend was. The only thing I will change next time is to reduce the lemon zest to about a tablespoon. the zest of one whole lemon almost overpowered the recipe, and my guys didn't like that. Might also add mozarella cheese to make it a little richer.

To be honest I do not care for lasagna at all but this recipe sounded wonderful so gave it a shot last night. . I did make a few changes from the original. I hand sliced the eggplant and zucchini and were much thicker than Natasha’s so roasted both in the oven for 10 minutes before assembling the dish. I also added lots of mozzarella and Parmesan because I love Gooey food. I used my homemade marinara put the dish together baked and it was beyond fabulous. Will definitely Make again.
Loved cooking this! It was delicious.
Okay, one of the best salmon dishes on this site! I cooked it under the broiler since it's easier but honestly the salad topping is what really makes it! I love this recipe.

Loved this! I used kalamata olives. I prepared the topping (less the fresh basil) a day in advance and refrigerated it. I brought the topping to room temperature the next day and added the fresh basil just before serving. I served this with the couscous. I'm glad I have leftovers.

Trying to get my husband to like salmon. He will eat it if I make fresh salmon patties and tolerate one other recipe. I made this last night and he can’t stop raving about it. I did ours on the stove and it was perfect. Crispy on the outside and juicy inside. As I sautéed it I did cut off the thinner ends as they got done and placed them on top of the thicker ends so they’d stay warm. The tomato/olive tepanade was great !

The salad was good enough to hide the fact that I was using 1.5-year-old frozen salmon fillets, but I bet this would be out of this world with fresh, bbq’d salmon! I used Kalamata olives and dried basil.
Loved it! Quick and easier version of the copycat Buca Di Beppo Salmon Siracusa I often make! Delish
Used kalamata olives, shallots & dried basil. Also made the entire meal on the stove - came out almost stew-like...YUM! We're on a low-carb diet and this is going into our weekly rotation! Thanks!

This was very easy to make. I found the flavor nice and light. It presented nicely as well, plenty of colors. I served this over whole wheat pasta and with a side of Broccoli With Balsamic Dressing (Broccoli With Balsamic Dressing). Also a good recipe to try! Thanks for the recipe, mandabears!

This is a keeper. I served it over grilled salmon. I used kalamata olives (because that's what I had) and I substituted dried basil - I couldn't find/didn't have fresh. It still turned out to be one of the best recipes for salmon. Thanks!
Loved it. The relish and fish combo was as good to look at as it was to eat. DW/DD loved it as well. It was very easy to make. Followed the recipe exactly.
Really liked these veggies! Didn't have eggplant and used sweet potatoes and threw in some mushrooms, but it was still sooo good. Was even better in leftovers the next day.

My dh & I really enjoyed this dish. It was the first time that we tried eggplant and we loved it. It was quick and easy to make, tender and crisp with a slightly sweet, yet savory flavor. I used white balsamic vinegar and green onions instead of chives, I also added a small sweet potato. Thank you starrynews for sharing a recipe that we will enjoy again and again.

I love roasted vegetables, but this was even better than I expected. The marinade flavors really come thru, it was sweet and tangy, and really delicious! Thanks for posting this, it really hit the spot tonight! Made for ZWT 9
This was wonderful. There was not one morsel left! Next time, more eggplant, less potatoes. Thanks for posting.

We really enjoyed this tasy dish & will make it again. The eggplant was divine & paired wonderfully with the potatoes. The balsamic gave a nice undertone with a slightly sweet highlight. Thank you for sharing the recipe!

Very good, a great side for any Mediterranean feast, very festive and colorful -- and yet a little less than expected. Bell peppers dominated the flavors while the vinegar, oil, and herbs just didn't rise to the surface. I think I would use more marinade overall and try using fresh herbs instead of dried. For all that, very enjoyable and will be seen on our table again. Made for 2010 Favorites.

Really easy. Very versatile. I've been using your recipe now for a few years in alternative ways each time. I always add potatoes to whatever I put in here (peppers, mushrooms, sweet potatoes, squash, onions, brussel sprouts) so that my kids will always have something to pick out that they like. I have been forgetting to add your seasoning listed above but will start. All I ever do is drizzle balsamic, add a bit of olive oil, a non toxic season salt like Penzys, garlic seasoning or cloves, salt and pepper and I'm good to go. Thanks again for getting us started on a life long love of roasted veggies.

Ambrosia! We don't care for eggplant, so I put in 3 carrots, sliced about 1/3-inch thick on the diagonal. Now, I am looking forward to experimenting with all sorts of veggie combinations. The oil, vinegar, and seasonings are what makes this special and I venture to say that any combination of veggies would be delicious, providing that they want to cook for about the same length of time. Definitely a keeper in all its variations.

My favorite way to make veggies and this recipe was delish. I love eggplant, but chose to use new potatoes, red onion, peppers, yellow and zucchini squash. Soooo good. Made for What's on the Menu tag game.

So easy and soooo good! I made a few changes; I used two large potatoes and 2 large zucchini in place of the eggplant, and I didn't have any chives so I bumped the basil up to 1 tsp in it's place. I cut my potatoes in smaller chunks to reduce the cooking time, and ended up cooking it 22 minutes, stirring it, then 10 minutes more and my veggies were all nice and soft. I also skipped the cooking spray part and coated my veggies in a large bowl with the oil and herbs. I was a little scared of 2 TBS of vinegar, but it wasn't a problem at all. I'm extremely excited about this because, to me, I felt like I was eating vegetarian hash but wasn't missing the meat a bit. Thanks so much!!

Ok, I live with 4 sons and a husband, who are all sworn carnivores. I had to make something healthy for company, and this looked easy. WOW! All of my men devoured all of the veggies, and then promptly asked for more. It's a great recipe, since you can throw whatever kind of vegetable you have on hand. I followed it the way it was written, just let it sit on the counter for an hour or so marinating before roasting. It thankfully is now a new staple at our summer cook outs, so thank you very, very much!
Really like this combination. Even picky DS ate it. Made just as stated. Made for "The Apron String Travelers" and ZWT9.

What a delicious medley of colors and flavors! I added a bit of sweet potato which was very good with the mix and added a little color and sweetness as well. Next time I will add sliced mushroom and some sliced zucchini. Thanks so much for posting!

Fabulous blend of favors. I didn't have chives, so I used dill instead. Also left out the eggplant
( food allergy), but I added white, and sweet potatoes. Y U M M Y !!

This was delicious and I wouldn't change a thing. I did add 2 small zucchini as I had them in the fridge, and I used only red bell peppers as I like the sweetness of them. I loved the tang of the balsamic. My veggies were getting a bit crispy after 15 minutes, so I covered them with foil for the remainder of the baking. They came out moist and flavorful. Great, easy recipe - DH absolutely loved these, so I'll make them again. I served these as a side to recipe #426762, and the combo was perfect! Thanks for posting Starry - made for "LET'S P-A-R-T-Y TAG 2010", December 2010!

This was an easy, roasted veggie recipe. We liked it. It is different with the balsamic, though I am not sure I prefer it this way compared to just roasting it in olive oil. I served as a side to Recipe #224947 224947. Thanks!
Great recipe. I will not use eggplant next time, I do not like the texture. I will use the recipe again. Made for Veggie Swap.

What a wonderful aroma emanates for the oven while this is cooking! The completed dish doesn't disappoint, either. I prepared this using red and orange peppers. The veggies and sauce were all mixed up together in a large bowl before spreading on a parchment paper lined tray and roasted. Made for Veggie Swap 25.

This combination is always a winner! I especially liked the red pepper with the balsamic vinegar. I cut everything smaller and is was fully cooked in about 25 mins. Made for ZWT 6 ZINGO by one of the Unrulies Under the Influence

Great roasted veggies! I don't care for onion so left it out, otherwise made as specified. The addition of the balsamic vinegar before roasting gave this a unique flavor. Thanks for sharing the recipe! Made for ZWT6, Zwizzle Chicks
Great version of roasted vegetables. The sauce really gives the vegetables wonderful flavor. Thanks! *Made for Seasoned Sailor and his Sassy Sirens ZWT 6*

Yummy recipe. I didn't have eggplant so I substituted with yellow squash. I also used from herbs from my garden and added some parsley as well. I recommend cutting your potatoes smaller than the instructed size. I had a few that could have been cooked a little bit longer. Made & enjoyed for Zinga ZWT6.

My son and I really enjoyed this with some salad! I cut all the veggies into about same size chunks and it all cooked nicely. Thanks! Made for Zingo-Zaar World Tour#6 by a fellow Looney Spoon Phoodie!

Wonderful and easy recipe for roasted vegetables. I peeled the potatoes but not the eggplants, and used only green bell peppers (which is what I had on hand). I cut the onion into chunks as that seemed more in keeping with the size of the other veggies. I stirred several times. I usually have all these ingredients on hand, so will be able to make and enjoy often. Thanks for posting.

Very easy way to spruce up veggies. I loved it and will use it often. I had peppers, carrots, onions, zucchini and potatoes and will def use eggplant next time. Thanks Starry. Made for ZWT6 by fellow Looney Spoon.

* Reviewed for ZWT6 Whine and Cheese Gang* Easy to put together and roasted perfectly. Left my potatos a little on the large side....so did take an extra 10 minutes to cook. I used a little extra olive oil and balsamic. This was a really tasty vege dish. The capsicums/peppers and red onion were super sweet. The garlic flavour wasn't even noticeable. Photos also being posted

Very, very, very good! Will have to make this again. We left the potatoes unpeeled, but did peel the eggplant. Used one green and one red pepper. Garlic aroma was strong while cooking, but not when eating. Balsamic vinegar made this sweet. Being vegetarians, we ate 1/3 each with a meat substitute. Also, used about half olive oil. Pretty dish too!
Made to accompany Recipe #230043. Real vegetable goodness - and so easy. I loved how all the flavours melted into one another. Thanks.

Made this recipe for 2. The potatoes, were a little large even when I scaled them down they were a touch firm. The smell of this cooking was torture, but well worth the wait. We will make this again and I will try to work the size cuts of my veggies. Thank you so much for posting. Made for ZWT 6.
This was fantastic! My family loved it. I followed the recipe exact and used an orange and green bell pepper. Thanks Starry! Made for ZWT6 - LOONEY SPOON PHOODIES!

I LOVE this! I kid you not, my mouth was watering just tossing the veggies to begin with. The aroma of the balsamic and herbs is amazing. I used fresh chives and basil instead of dried, as I had them on hand. I also used two colors of pepper, yellow & green (next time I'll definitely use red for the color). This was super easy to make. I peeled the veggies but then remembered your intro saying we don't have to, so next time I won't and it'll be even easier! The red onion, olive oil & balsamic caramelized in the oven and added even more flavor than I thought possible. I love eggplant, especially roasted (the first way I ever ate it), but I have to say that the potatoes kept a little firmness & caramelized just a bit that they turned out to be my favorites. I wish I'd put in more of them (12 oz was only two small potatoes). My toddler DD really enjoyed this recipe as well (except the green pepper) and if she'll eat it all gone then it's a good recipe! This one's not just good though, it's great! Thanks so much for sharing, Starry. We already can't wait to make it again! :) Made & enjoyed for ZWT-6 Team Xtra Hot Dishes!

We love any type of roasted veggies, and this was no exception! I especially loved the eggplant in this, first time trying it roasted and I would say that I prefer eggplant this way. Thanks Starry for a wonderful recipe that we will definitely enjoy again! Made for ZWT6 by a fellow Looney Spoon :)

I just made this on the weekend after reading so many positive reviews and will NOT be making it again. It was easy to make, but I found it very bland. Maybe if I increased the amount of salt and pepper I used it would have been better? Cook time was very accurate though.
Big hit with everyone. Roasted it a little longer at 350 half way through to cook the potatoes. It also cooked the pork. Added zucchini. Cooked mushrooms and kale on the side. Fabulous meal!
Superb recipe. Delicious served with roast chicken, I’ll add salmon next time!

Subbed Zucchini for the Eggplant. I used the Convection Roast setting at 400F which really caramelized the veg - sometimes when mixing in potatoes with high liquid content veggies I find it all can come out soggy. Not in this case! Great flavour from the balsamic... good idea.
I love these veggies! Lovely flavour. Great as a side to roast lamb or any Mediterranean themed dish.
Magical flavours!!! Huge hit and saved as a fave!!! Thank you :)
I made this with only vegetables including mushrooms! My husband is NOT a vegetable person, but he loved this! The next day I made an omelet with the left over vegetables and it was delicious!

What a fabulous side dish! I added Italian Sausage for a full meal and the only other thing I added was a 1/2 tsp mint. Only because I like mint in any Mediterranean dish. This was a big hit with the family!

This is a good veggie combo and the dressing gave it a great flavor. I had a somewhat large eggplant and used it all so there was more eggplant than all the other veggies which was fine. I used an orange and a yellow pepper and baby yellow potatoes. This made a LOT of veggies which is good for leftover lunches. Made for ZWT9.

Love this recipe!! It tasted like I the vegetables were grilled, perfect for when it's not grilling season. I made this as is, except I chickened out on the eggplant and substituted mushrooms instead. We'll be making this again for sure, so maybe next time I'll try it out with the eggplant :)

Oh my this was delicious!!! I haven't used balsamic vinegar before but yummy! I followed the instructions except for adding a zucchini which was in the fridge and needed to be used. Thank you for posting. Made for February Sun and Spice Event tag game. Served with recipe#421073#421073.

OMG! AMAZING! I used fresh eggplant, squash, and zucchini from the garden and added vidalia onion, sliced peppers, and diced hash brown potatoes. It was one of the best sides I have ever made! Going straight to my favorites folder! Thanks!
This is so good. The veggies had a wonderful taste. I omitted the potatoes. The dressing on top brings so much flavor to the veggies. Thanks Starrynews :) Made for your win for the Tic Tac Toe

This was great! I omitted the feta cheese, and used walnuts instead of pine nuts. Also, I wasn't sure if you meant dried oregano or fresh, and all I had was dried, so I used the given amount of dried oregano, even though it looked like a bit much! However, it all came together in the end, with the crunch of the walnuts complimenting the kidney beans, tomatoes, and cousous to perfection! Thanks stephanie!
Yumbo! I used Isreali couscous, which is bigger than other types of couscous and it was fab!

I really enjoyed this dish, it was very light and refreshing. The only reason I'm not giving it a 5 star is because my kids weren't really fans and my husband was indifferent. I will still make this again, but to take for lunch instead of for the whole family. Thanks for the recipe!
Loved this salad with Mediterranean Tilapia Pockets. Easy and such great flavors.
I loved this fresh tasting couscous salad! Perfect combination of ingredients and flavors and it was so easy. I made no modifications. I'll definitely be making this again! Thanks!
this was good, but i think i'd like it even more without the feta...and, i love feta. i did omit the pine nuts since i didn't have them. overall, a good dish. thanks for posting

An interesting salad. I was looking for something to make using kidney beans and came across this salad. I had never come across the combination of couscous and kidney beans before. I followed the recipe except for omitting the pine nuts (didn't have any) and I used Danish Feta which has a softer texture and tastes not unlike a mild goats cheese. It really was delicious and everyone commented on how good it tasted. I will make it again.

I needed an easy recipe that didn't need to be kept hot or cold so when I was really excited when I came across it. I made it exactly according to the recipe except used fat-free feta and was probably a little short on how much feta I had on hand. It was so delicious! I made the couscous thenight before and then just threw the rest together...it sat for over an hour at room temperature and was perfect because the flavors had a chance to marry and being at room temp really made the flavors stand out. This is going to become a go-to recipe for potlucks or get-togethers where I need an easy side!
Everybody loved it! My daughter had a blast helping make it. We used chickpeas instead of kidney beans. Will make again, thanks!! :)
Great dish! I wholeheartedly agree that it's great with chickpeas in place of the kidney beans, and with the addition of high quality black olives.
This turned out very good! I included all of the ingredients except for the pine nuts. It was easy to put together, and made a nice light dinner. Great week-night recipe!
we really enjoyed this, especially with the chickpeas instead of the kidney beans.

I have the same recipe for the first 5 ingredients but for the beans I have chickpeas and then just salt and pepper-thought I'd mention it here as an alternative instead of listing is separately. Glad you posted it!

Nice tasting recipe! I fought my need to mess with the recipe and did as posted with the exception of using red beans instead of kidney beans - just what I had on hand. This was subtle, and I can't wait to see how the tastes meld overnight. Thanks for a great summer salad!

I admit that I was a bit skeptical of this recipe, but I had all the ingredients on hand so I went ahead and tried it. VERY flavorful!! And I enjoyed eating it while the couscous was still a little warm. Will definitely make again.

Hum hum hum! This was very good! But I did change a few things: I only used 1 tomato, 3/4 cup of feta, 1 tablespoon of oregano, added the beans and skipped the nuts. It was so good. I will make more for sure! Thank you so much for sharing!

This made for a wonderful lunch! I made it in the evening and took it to work the following day.....travels well. I omitted the oil all together as I was after an ultra light meal. I used cherry tomatoes which I halved, reduced the amount of feta slightly and added 1 tbsp small capers. Loved it YUM!

Very good. I made this ahead of time (8 hours or so) and it was great. I'm eating it today as leftovers. I used toasted slivered almonds instead of pine nuts. Next time I will add sliced kalamata olives. I think it would enhance the recipe alot.
Fast, so easy and wonderfully tasty!! I added kalamata olives for an extra kick!

Wow! Amazingly fast and very flavorful. Used halved cherry tomatoes because I had them in the fridge. Used black beans because that was all I had, halved the feta cheese and used 2 Tblsp of the pine nuts and voila!! Thanks.
I have made this salad a lot over the summer, it's fast, easy and very tasty!
Very flavourful. I used quinoa instead of couscous and it worked just fine (and I didn't use kidney beans this time around, but will next time to make it a 'meal').

A lot of flavor for such an easy to make dish. I made this exactly as directed and also added the kidney beans. This is a very good couscous dish. I will be making it again. I may go a little lighter on the feta cheese. Either way this is a keeper.
This was so good. I think everyone should try this immediatly. You won''t be disappointed!!!
These were awesome! Very quick and easy. And the Tzatziki sauce is very good. This recipe is worth it for that alone.
Easy, delicious, full of flavor. Will put this in the rotation! I do think the turkey burgers need more than 4 mins per side but I am going to grill them the next time.

The 3-star rating if for the recipe as is. After the following changes, we would rate it 5 stars.
We roasted the red pepper and removed the skin. However, we found the flavor of the kalamata olives to be very overpowering. To fix this, we added an extra half of a red pepper (raw, not roasted), 2 tablespoons of plain yogurt, 1 extra tablespoon of lemon juice, 1 extra tablespoon of tahini, and 1 extra tablespoon of parsley. It was fine after these additions... and this resulted in more hummus :-) See More

Oh my word, thank you for this absolutely fabulous recipe! I thought it was the best hummus I have ever had the pleasure to have tasted. And I made it!
The only thing I did to change it was pour boiling water on my chick peas a couple of times, stir it around a bit to get the skin like covering off the peas. The skin coverings float to the top.
It may take a wee bit more time, but it allows for a more creamier hummus. Again, thank you! See More
I made it for myself and a couple of moms I had over for lunch. It was sooo delicious. I like the spiciness...just right!
OOOH My goodness this is so so yummy! Try this! My friend loved it too!! I also love #117045, #35625, and #11424.

this hummus is SOOOOOOOO good! I have been wanting to try this recipe for quite sometime and I'm so glad I finally got to making it, it's just delicious! I increased the garlic and added in lots black pepper, I can't wait to make this again, thanks for sharing this great hummus recipe hon!...Kitten :)
See More

When my local wholesale club stopped carrying my favorite kalamata hummus, I came here looking for a reasonable substitute. This was fantastic! My guests devoured it in no time. Next time I'll have to double the recipe.
this was very good. i made exactly as posted, next time i will lighten up the garlic and eliminate the bell pepper completely
mmmm! Hummus!! I could die I love it so much! I added 6 cloves of garlic...and WOW! What a taste! A great recipe that is with pitas or just crackers!
This is very different from the hummous we are used to. It is very good, served it with pita .. Mine was very runny and I had to serve it in a bowl .. thanks for sharing!

This is my 1st attempt at hummus and it's a winner. Dh has never been a big fan but loved this recipe and commented that it's the best he's ever had. I made the recipe "as is" except on the olives, I had searched out pitted kalamata olives with no luck and resorted to a greek mix of pitted olives. I picked out all the kalamata which wasn't quite 3/4 of a cup and filled the cup with a variety of the other olives to get the correct amount - it worked and the taste was superb. I did find that a drained can of garbanzo beans is a scant 1 1/2 cups worth so I went with it. I did not add any water to thin out - it was the perfect consistency for us. I served it with baby carrots, sliced cucumbers and thin sesame rice crackers. I'm looking forward to serving this for company!

This hummus is unbelievable good. It turns a simple dish into heaven on earth. What a combination of flavors. The garbanzo beans hold together all the different single flavors without to smother them. There is the nutty flavor of tahini and the delightful sharpness of cayenne. The capers, garlic and the olives add their own flavors. The lemon juice supported each single flavor and adds freshness (together with parsley). You can really dip anything into this piece of cooking jewellery and you will be excited. I have tried it today with simple pan seared tuna (wonderful). Try it, love and come back here to render homage to ncmysteryshopper for this out of this world hummus.

There's always someone that adds that little 'extra' touch that makes a 'plain' recipe extraordinary. This one's IT for sure!! The ONLY change I made was to double the garlic and use LIME juice instead.
i was disappointed when i heard we were having hummus and bread for lunch as i dont care for hummus. This was so good! The flavors are out of this world! Ours was not too runny. we enjoyed this one!

I meant to try this & review it for RSC, but time didn't permit. However, I've tried it now, though I admit to using regular black olives as I'm out of kalamatas.This is one of the best tasting hummuses I have tried and I collect hummus recipes. I did find it a little thin, & would probably add more chickpeas next time like Sackville Girl. However, the important thing is the flavor and that was delicious.

This was great -- so good in fact that I thought we'd have one bowl and save the rest but we ended up scoffing 4 bowls of it! I didn't need to add any extra water, in fact if anything I felt the dip was a touch on the runny side and might add more chickpeas next time, but other than that it was perfect. Zingy and easy to make. Thanks!
This was good. It was even bettr the next day. I will be eating this simple but delicious hummus often.
This is a new Hummus Favorite.Something has finnaly replaced my spicy black bean favorite.
Outstanding Hummus Chef! We all loved it! I made a huge batch of it so I have pleanty on hand. This is so much better than store bought deli hummus!! Thank you!

This is, for sure, a five star recipe. I put everything but the capers in a blender and pulsed it until it was well blended but still had minced parts. I spread it on a unbaked pizza crust, topped with fairly thick sliced beef tomatoes and sliced swiss cheese and baked! BTW, I put one caper at the tip of what would be each slice. This whole thing was yummy...the tomatoes added the extra moisture needed and the swiss cheese added sweetness. Will sure use this hummus again, but who knows how?

Absolutely delightful! Loved the blend of flavours in this hummus - the capers and olives really kicked things up. Dead on in the amounts of ingredients and easy-to-follow instructions (and easy-to-make recipe!). Definitely a winning combination. Good luch, chef.

So simple, so delicious, so fresh - this is perfect for such a beautiful sunny spring day! I added some fresh ground pepper, used pearl boccocini for the mozzerella, and vidalia onion for my sweet onion. I love it! Thanks for posting, Brooke! Made for Zaar Stars Tag.

THis was easy, healthy and good! THe flavor was missing something for me (that I can't quite put my finer on) but since it was so easy and good for you I'll probably make it again. Thanks so much Brooke!!
I was actually surprised at how much my husband ate of this. He's not big on vinegar. I did think it was lacking flavor so I added sugar, salt, and garlic powder. (didn't use fresh garlic)

Had some chickpeas I cooked myself and this looked like a good recipe to try. I made it twice, added a lot more balsamic vinegar because it didn't have enough flavor for me. Also left out the cheese the second time, it was just as good.
This was a most enjoyable salad. With the cheese this could easily be a full meal on it's own but it was great with grilled chicken. A wonderful balance of flavors.

I do not hesitate to rate this recipe with five stars. This is so easy, refreshing, and healthy. I followed the directions as written, but did use yellow onion and Kosher salt instead of sweet onion and sea salt. I don't think it really changed the recipe. This is a nice cooling recipe that is great for summer and lunch boxes. Thank you for sharing.

I love a chickpea salad and yours is a keeper; love the combinations of all these ingredients; umm good. I am always going back in the fridge for another taste; thanks for posting. Made this for ZWT6. Rita

I took this salad to a backyard BBQ this weekend as my side dish. It was served with burgers, brats, ribs, hot dogs, etc. The crowd loved it and finished it off. Very easy to make, literally chop everything and throw it into one bowl. I used feta cheese instead of mozzarella, and waited to add it until right before it was served. I also used table salt instead of sea salt, tasted great!!

This is great. I omitted the mozzarella and enjoyed this on WW, half the recipe for 8 points. Delicious and satisfying for dinner. Thanks for posting. This will be great once the weather starts getting warmer too!
LOVED this dish - made as a main lunch dish with the greens - and then as a side with our grilled meat. Easy and flavorful! Thank you for a great summer salad option! **Made for ZWT5**

Easy to prepare and delicious, this one is a keeper! I left out the parsley and basil and we do not care for them, and used fresh goat-milk feta instead of the mozzarella. Made for the Dining Daredevils for ZWT5.
I made this for DH's lunch. It was quick & easy to do. I did leave out the cheese because he doesn't like it. Thanks

Pleasing recipe. Great that it has no added sugar and so little oil. I chose to make it without the cheese, and it was fine. I'm sure it would be richer with it but sometimes you do what you have to do.

What a yummy & healthy lunch, I'd run out of garlic so sprinkled a little garlic salt over the top before adding the oil & vinegar and used parmesan cheese, really tasty & comes together in no time! Thanks Brooke!

A wonderfully delicious - and SO healthy - summer salad. I made this exactly to the recipe - except for using chives instead of the sweet onion and doubling the garlic (a matter of availability and personal taste preferences) and served it on a bed of baby spinach leaves. I'll be making this again during the summer months. Thank you for sharing another fabulous recipe, Brooke!
this was very good - i left out the onion and parsley, because i didn't have it - and ate it with some romaine lettuce, later this week, i'm sure i'll use it as a pita filling too

Loved it! I didn't have quite enough cucumber so I added sweet bell pepper and olives. Also, I halved the recipe and served it as a side salad, using shredded mozzarella rather than cubed. Delicious! Thanks Brooke! Made for Zaar Stars, please see my rating system as I rate tougher than most.

What a terrific, colorful and tasty salad! I served this on a baed of baby spinach, and it made a great, filling lunch. I wouldn't hesitate to serve this as a nice side dish salad for a picnic. I made this just as written, but used a little more onion. Thanx for sharing!
Great. served it for my sons 1st birthday.
very good although it needed a few amount adjustments and fresh ground black pepper, I used green onions in place of the sweet onion as I have a huge crop in my garden, thanks for sharing Brooke!
Delicious and a perfect 'beat the heat' main-dish type of salad. I used feta instead of the mozz and mint instead of the parsley. Loved the combo. Ate with pita bread.
A delicious and refreshing salad, especially on a steamy summer night. I love the addition of the mozzarella! Thanks, Brooke.

amazing!! i simply love chickpeas and they taste great with the tomatoes and cucumbers. i usually have a salad with chickpeas, tomatoes, and cucumbers, but the basil and garlic take this up to the next level! made for zwt4

I really loved the flavor of the beans and veggies! The only change I will make next time is to add the mozarella just before serving. When the cheese soaked in the vinegar for an hour in the fridge it came out tasting....... not like mozarella. Other than that, delish! Thanks for a light lunch recipe!

Excellent! Absolutely gorgeous, and very tasty, not to mention healthy! I used half the amount of cheese and it was plenty. (I was out of "good" mozzarella, so I cut up two cheese sticks. Don't tell my kids!!) I was also out of cucumber, which would definitely add a nice cool flavor next time. I added some diced roasted red bell pepper, too. This was the perfect lunch. Thanks, I'll make this again and again!

Really very tasty. I made it exactly as directed except for one change. I used 4 oz. of crumbled goat cheese instead of the mozzarella. I did not serve it over a mixed green salad, because it stands on its own. I will definitely be making this again! Made for PAC Spring 2008.
this made a yummy lunch today! I scaled the recipe down for one. I loved the balsamic vinegar in this. Thanks Brooke!

Love this recipe for an easy tzatziki. I don’t salt my cucumber, instead I grate and squeeze them in a dish towel to remove all the liquid. Have never had an issue with watery leftovers. I don’t use a blender, instead I just mix everything in one bowl. And refidgerate for a while. Easy to adjust this to taste.
I worked for a Greek/Lebanese restaurant, and we would make this with sour cream instead of yogurt. Really tasty!

For 14+ years I lived in Tarpon Springs, FL which has a very large population of Greeks. So, I've had real, authentic Greek-style food and my favorite was their gyros. I LOVED those gyros which, of course, are served with tzaztiki sauce. This recipe is amazing! I made it exactly as the recipe stated and it was so good I'm making more for dipping veggies for our Fourth of July party this weekend! I did use an English cucumber because of its mild flavor (I don't like cucumbers) but I changed NOTHING in this recipe because it was perfect! Thank you so much for such a delicious recipe!

Made the recipe here's what I'd change. Use 1 container full fat Greek yogurt as is don't bother with squeezing. Peel, seed and finely grate 3 cucumbers. Squeeze out liquid from cukes. Using a garlic press take around 10 garlic cloves to start press add more to your preference. Juice of 1 lemon 2 tablespoons each finely chopped mint and dill salt white pepper mix in bowl all ingredients omit blender
I wanted a garlicy tzatziki so I had to add 11 cloves of garlic. Great recipe! Edit: Tried it an hour later and it was too spicy. Probably should stick to 5-6 cloves
You can also use Icelandic Skyr which is a thicker kind of yoghurt which means you don't have to drain the cucumber as much.

I have looked up at least 10 recipes for tzatziki sauce, yours by far is the most detailed!! Salt to draw out water, paper towel, mix to taste, saying mint, dill options etc. food.com I will go to you first for future reference.

Drain the yogurt for 24 hrs, pour off the liquid to monitor drainage. Drain the cucumber for several hrs and pour off the liquid to monitor drainage like with the yogurt. Pour cucumber onto a pad of several paper towels, fold up around it and pat it down. This will help remove some salt and get more liquid off.

Excellent -- we have many middle-eastern restaurants in Chicago and this sauce is as good as the best of them! Blended this recipe with another, so used more dill (1/2 cup), 1 teaspoon salt, 3-4 passes of ground pepper on the top of the bowl, and 1 teaspoon salt. Short a couple of fresh ingredients, so used dried dill and bottled Volcano Lemon Juice and surprising that worked just fine. Did have Kirkland (Costco) non-fat Greek Yogurt which worked well and that makes this a very healthy sauce!

Didn't have yogurt, used sour cream; didn't have lemon, used lime and used less than 3 T; only used 1 tsp of salt, grated the cucumber and garlic on a box grater because I didn't want to pull out the food processor; used Asian cucumbers. I think because of grating the cucumber it pulled out all the water and was very thick and creamy. Served with shish kabob and grilled flat bread, EVERYONE loved it. It was fantastic on the shish kabob wraps...and the grilled potatoes!! Thank
This recipe is spot-on and very simple to use. Only took 45 minutes to make. I used a 3/4 tbl dill and 1/4 mint in mine. Excellent!

I've made this four times and loved it, but I started off using just 1/2 tsp, then 1 tsp salt on the cucumbers. Today I tried the full tablespoon and its no-where near as good. The salt on the cucumbers ABSOLUTELY needs to be reduced to 1 teaspoon, not 1 tablespoon, and I wonder if that was just a typo when the recipe was input? Others have complained of a watery result and I'll say: 1) you HAVE to use GREEK yogurt. It should be thick enough to stand a fork up in. 2) after salting and pressing for 30 minutes, ring out the cucumber. I'd suggest wrapping them in a smooth towel if you have one and squeezing with all your might. (The cucumber bits will get caught in the loops of a terry towel, and will be too wet for a paper towel probably.) I also leave the skin on the cucumber which works perfectly fine--just a bit more color and texture. I serve this with Greek pilaf rice and Iranian kubideh (basically, lamb meatball).

This was an okay sauce. I've made other versions of tzatziki sauce that I liked better. This one came out a little thinner than I would have liked. I think it's because the recipe has you blend the cucumber and spices before adding to the yogurt. In previous recipes I've tried, you just dice the cucumber and add the seasonings to the yogurt instead of blending it all up to make a puree. I probably won't be making this recipe again.
Don’t Salt the Cucumbers! Grate the cucumbers otherwise you will never get the water out of them! Unless you are feeding an army only Make 1/3 recipe!
Mine tastes lemony.... Hopefully after a few hours in fridge it will be better
This is so good. Makes a ton. Will cut it in half next time.
Added a touch of salt and pepper... yum

Really delicious! Very similar to what I buy at our local Greek market. I'm generally the only one that eats it, so I cut the recipe into 1/3, and used one small garlic clove. I needed it in a hurry, so grated the cucumber really, really fine, as Stevee D mentioned, and drained it (saving the juice for coctails!), then soaked up the remaining liquid with a paper towel. Hopefully it won't be too watery come morning, but the cuke was quite dry to the touch when I put it in. Anyway, delicious! (Also, I should mention that I used very, very thick homemade yogurt from the Greek market, and just used a whisk for mixing.)
I threw everything into a blender (except I only added 1 tsp Himalayan salt) and it turned out great with lots of silicone spatula stirs in between each blending. Just to save time #momlife
Tried this recipe and it came out way too sour, too much lemon juice. Waste of my money for ingredients while on a fixed budget.
I like this as a base recipe for tzatziki, I personally like a bit more garlic and herbs in mine.. that being said everyone who has tasted this recipe from me so far really likes it!

This was great. I cut it down to 1/3 of the recipe and it still made a lot. Used one cup sour cream, half of a regular cucumber (didn't salt it), one tbsp lemon juice and used the whole clove of garlic. I used dried dill and no mint and it still turned out utterly delicious and authentic tasting.
In place of thick yogurt, or perhaps the same, I use yogurt cheese or kefir. Love it!
Recipe sounds really good, but should i use a sooon to remove seeds from cucumber before cutting the cucumber?
So so yummy!

Excellent Tzatziki sauce. Recipe modification suggestions: I would suggest that you halve your cucumber lengthwise, scoop out and discard the seeds before chopping. I wring out the chopped, salted cucumber in a square of cheesecloth to get all the excess liquid out. The more liquid you get out of the cucumber, the creamier the sauce. I replaced 1/3 of the Greek Yogurt with a new product on the market - Greek cream cheese & Yogurt blend! I placed the Greek cream cheese in the food processor with the cucumber, garlic, dill, lemon juice & pepper. Scrape down the sides frequently and pulse until smooth. The addition of the Greek cream cheese really makes the Tzatziki creamy & thick!
Great recipe. Good combination of all the ingredients - not too garlicky - but really tasty. I used fresh mint and it was delicious.

Made this using vegan sour cream (tofutti), used mint, parsley and dill...very very good...didn't do any prep to the cukes...just diced and added all the ingredients...awesome vegan option...taste just like full fat dairy version!!
A little bit of dill goes a LONG way, but this recipe is very, very tasty! I didn't press my cucumbers, so the sauce was creamier and had more cucumber flavor. I loved it and will make it again!!
Excellent!! Use lots of freshly cracked black pepper, fresh dill, and the best yogurt you can afford. I left the peel on the cucumber which made it healthier and a brighter green.
The flavor was off and the sauce was way to thin. Will not make again, I'm going to look for a different recipe.

This came out very good! I cut the recipe by 3 since I only had one cup of whole fat Greek yogurt and 1 English cucumber (used half if the recipe). I definitely didn't need more salt since the cucumbers are salted while drying out. I was worried it would be too salty but drying the cucumbers with a paper towel wiped off some of the salt. I sliced the other half of the cucumber and plan on dipping them into the tzatziki sauce for a healthy snacks. Thanks for the great recipe!
Great Greek Yogurt Recipe. I made it and it was delicious. Regards and thanks again for share this.

Made this recipe for the first time today and totally LOVE it! I used the recommended greek cheese, and made sure to sweat the cucumbers. It turned out thick, rich and tasty, a staple in my recipe box for sure!!

My sauce came out watery and pretty bitter. Note to self for next time, make sure the cucumber is sweet and not bitter. Also the recipe does not mention this but use yogurt WITH FAT, that's super important and helps reduce the bitterness. I wish I had known before making mine. Also make sure to cut out all the seeds in the cucumbers and salt them well. The recipe will come out very watery, which is kind of gross.

Mmmmm.....turned out just right! Incredibly easy. I used dill and look forward to trying it with mint. I had to use a regular cucumber and just seeded it. I halved the recipe and it made a lot. Thanks for posting the recipe!
My husband would drink this stuff if I would let him. We put it on everything, burgers, veggies, and any Greek food, of course. If you don't have yogurt, sour cream works well, too!
Very good recipe. I used Fage 2% Greek yogurt. It's nice and thick. Also, using fresh mint and dill from the garden really makes a difference.

This is a delicious sauce that I use for multiple recipes, including as a topping to my quinoa burgers. The only change I made is to use 1 tsp less salt at the beginning because it can be overpowering.
Wonderful!!!! I loved this sauce! Just the right touch for an authentic tasting gyro!! Thanks so much for posting!
Love this sauce!!

I only had 2 cups of Greek yogurt and regular cucumber, so I added 1 cup of sour cream instead and peeled and deseeded the regular cucumber. Added a little more garlic (just because we love garlic) and used both the fresh dill and mint from the garden. Lovely sauce...made pita bread and greek salad and greek chicken to go with it. Who needs to go out and eat when you can eat like this at home!
I just love this! I also put raisins(golden) in along with the capers.

This is a delicious dish, however your recipe is not in the traditional way. This is a Sicilian dish and we don't use peppers, nor balsamic vinegrette or brown sugar. The authentic way is to use cut whole tomatoes, ONLY Green olives, not the pimentos, red wine vinegar and white sugar to taste. This is a sweet/sour dish. Room temperature over a nice crusted bread or toasted crusted bread is ideal. This is a rustic dish and no pre-manufactured products are needed (puree & balsamic vinegrette)

I have now made this several times. This is an excellent and versatile recipe--I even froze a bunch of it and have reheated it to serve with pasta or as relish for a main dish. I did leave the skin on the eggplant for color and fiber. I also added a bit of white wine. thanks for posting!
Such a delicious recipe! I made it just as directed and it turned out great. Perfect as a side or a light summer meal with some crusty bread on the side.

This caponata was excellent. Very fresh tasting and had lively flavors. I skinned the eggplant because I don't like the toughness the skin sometimes has. Skipped the anchovies, although next time, I might get brave and try them. I served this on lightly toasted sliced baguette. Made a perfect light supper with a chilled bottle of white wine. Thanks 1Steve.
This is such a wonderful recipe. Very healthy I must add.

This is fabulous. It's the kind of recipe that says, "Take me home and make me yours." That each cook needs to think about how to make it special for him or her. I'm sure I will make it many times - I really needed a good eggplant recipe - and will change it around many different ways. Thank you very much for sharing this recipe with us, and also for the detailed explanation of how to use the caponata. I do have one question: the ingredient list calls for balsamic vinaigrette. Is that the same as balsamic vinegar? I used balsamic vinegar, and it seemed all right. Anyway, thank you. For many good recipes.

Never tried Caponata before but was making Jo Mama's spaghetti and my wife asked me to do a veggie dish starter. Made it as per recipe but didn't have any capers - chopped gherkins worked really well. Anyhow back to the review. My only criticism is that the Caponata was too greasy this was easily resolved next time of making by slicing the aubergine, laying the slices on a paper towel, lightly salting it then place a plate with some weight (cans or cookbooks) on top for at least 30 mins. This drains the water you can then fry the aubergine in loads less oil or better still bake in the oven till just brown.

We had this for a Thanksgiving side dish, and it just gets better and tastier the more it is reheated as leftovers. So far I have had it in a turkey sandwich, alone cold, or warm on a piece of garlic rubbed french bread. All equally delicious, and great flavor. I did not have oregano so I subbed Italian herb seasoning instead (dried) and did not add so much balsalmic vinegar, probably only about 1/3 cup? I used aged balsalmic vinegar though, so that might have changed the consistency a bit. Great recipe!

An excellent recipe. I have tried 3 different caponata recipes and this is by far the best. This is a wonderful recipe for gardeners who are trying to use up their fresh produce. The only changes I made was to use fresh tomatoes from my garden and just let it simmer a little longer to achieve the correct consistency and add more anchovies. I have frozen some of this recipe and it reheats well. It is great on toasted rye or french bread and over pasta. The anchovies are a must! Thanks for a great recipe. Valdez

WOW, absolutely DELICIOUS!!!! Debbie I have eaten quite a number of bulgur salads (always using millet in place of the bulgur), but this one really is one of the best! The flavours mingle perfectly and the dill and feta combined with the tomatoes and spinach are just super yummy! :) I used your recipe #415662 in place of the bulgur and it was very nice. Added a slightly nutty flavour to the salad. I will most definitely make this again as everyone just raved about it! THANKS SO MUCH for sharing this surpreme recipe here with us! Made and reviewed for my chosen chef in Veggie Swap #21 April 2010.

Wow! This was delicious. I was worried when I saw the amount of bulgar in the bowl soaking. I had to "nuke" the bulgur because after 40 minutes it was still crunchy. I reduced the dill to one tablespoon because dill is overpowering. I would add a1 tablespoon and a half next time. This salad was surprisingly Fantastic. I only added 3 ounces of Feta because that is what I had on hand. I did add the tomatoes which is a MUST in my opinion. It was so good. Did I say this was good?

This was fantastic! My only regret was that I couldn't get fresh dill (I did use some dill weed though), as I am sure that would have put it into a whole other dimension. Having said that, I loved this recipe! I will definitely be making this for the next gathering I attend. Thanks for posting!

I made this recipe but tweaked the amounts on ingredients. Only used 2 Tablespoons fresh dill and that was plenty. 1/3 cup would be too much for us. Overall it was good, but can't give stars since I changed the amounts so much from the original recipe.

I cannot believe how delicious this salad is! The dill really makes the salad. Do NOT omit the dill when making this salad. I added a bit of lemon juice to the Bulgar wheat before platting, otherwise made as stated. Made for PRMR Tag.

Not a boring salad at all. The fresh dill makes this so delicious. Although not noted, after you drain the Bulagr with the hot water you should then rinse it with very cold water and strain. Again a yummy delicious salad that will hold you up.
Nice fresh flavors. I used regular tomatoes, as that is what I had on hand. Made for Every Day Holiday Tag. :)

This was great to whip up and great to eat. I used baby silverbeet leaves out if my garden instead of spinach but I really doubt if there is much of a difference. I used fresh herbs too . The instructions for preparing the bulgar worked perfectly. I served this as a side to Asian flavoured sausages to DD and friends before they headed off to a party.Made for Everyday is a Holiday.

Perfect whole grain salad! Just wonderful, a bit crunchy, and awesome! I loved the use of bulgur combined with the taste of spinach and feta. All went so well together I wanted more. Didn't change one thing. Made for *Everyday is a Holiday* August 2009

I love this recipe! The little salad on top of the avocados is SO flavorful. It goes perfectly with the butteriness of the avocados. It's a great simple and healthy weeknight meal, or perfect as a side dish! Can't wait to make again.

The second time I made this I cheated and bought precut mixture of tomato, onion and jalapeno. Turned out great in half the time. I love bruschetta so this is my new go to item. Also used basil instead of oregano as I love basil.

So good! We eat lots of avocados here in So. Cal. I see this recipe being used often. I did use cilantro but besides that followed the recipe as written. Can't wait to try it with balsamic vinegar next time.

Made these as my contribution to a bar-b-q and they were a big hit. So simple, tasty and looked elegant. I was so pleased. Made exactly as directed except forgot to add the feta cheese. Bought it and all, just plain forgot. It was still awesome and I'll be making it again. May try balsamic vinager next time as I love the taste. Thanks for posting a wonderful recipe.
See More
I also added a few olives - and used white wine vinegar instead of red since I didn't have any - I will definitely be making this again
awesome!! I also put a few chopped black olives in it and drizzle it with balsamic glaze!!!
Yum!! I even got my little brother (11) to eat this healthy treat :) I subbed red wine vinegar for balsamic. Delicious!
Yum!!!! My husband LOVES this salad!! I cube the avocado and put it in with all the other ingredients~~much easier to eat! Taking this to a neighborhood gathering tomorrow! Thanks for sharing! :O)

Served this tonight and my family loved it. I removed the avocado from the shell, and doubled the olive oil and red wine vinegar, as we love dressing. The combination of all the ingredients was just delicious. Thanks for a great salad.

I made this to serve as a quick lunch alongside grilled shrimp skewers. It was terrfic & so easy to do! I loved that had different flavors instead of Mexican. I will definitely make this one again! Thank you for sharing the recipe.
This was a wonderful summer salad. I followed the lead of the other reviewers and added garlic and removed the avocado peel. Thanks! Great recipe.
This is just so good! I've found myself making this recipe often, and I get requests for it now as well! A wonderful salad to say the least, thanks for a great recipe.
I love avocados! This will be a regular recipe for me now. Thanks!
Wonderful! I used a tomato herb feta and therefore used less oregano. Feta and avocado may be a new favorite combination.

MMMM! Great, quick, and tasty light lunch. Easy to make!
